question:
Consider the following recursive function:
$f(0)$ $\;=\;$ $7,$
$f(n + 1)$ $\;=\;$ $f(n) + 6n + 1\; \ \text{for all}$ $\text{integers}\ n \geq 0.$
Which of the following is true? for all $n \geq 0$: $f(n) = 2n^2 + 2n + 7$ for all $n \geq 0$: $f(n) = 3n^2 + 2n + 7$ for all $n \geq 0$: $f(n) = 2n^2 - 2n + 7$ for all $n \geq 0$: $f(n) = 3n^2 - 2n + 7$
